Aggravating_Factors: History of abuse, vulnerability due to gender, lack of state protection in country of origin
Mitigating_Factors: Applicant's credibility, corroborative evidence of abuse, risk upon return
Criminality_Severity: High - ongoing physical and psychological harm
Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient to establish a credible basis for fear
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, supporting documents, country condition reports
Credibility_Assessment: RPD and RAD failed to adequately assess credibility; court found inconsistencies in review standard
Risk_Assessment: High risk of re-victimization if returned to Nigeria
Targeted_Individual_Status: Woman fearing return due to domestic abuse
Applicable_Statute: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and appeals
Legal_Provision: Section 96-100 IRPA (RAD mandate), principles of procedural fairness
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on standard of review and appeal rights
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim initially denied by RPD and upheld by RAD
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; decision set aside
Procedural_Issues: Incorrect standard of review applied by RAD (reasonableness vs. correctness/appeal standard)
Decision_Maker: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under the IRPA and Federal Courts Act
Authority: Federal Court has authority to review administrative decisions for reasonableness
Decision_Standard: Reasonableness standard improperly applied; hybrid appeal standard required
